text: 15.23 Tower Hamlets has a relatively limited supply of industrial land and floorspace, despite high levels of market demand, in the face of increasing competition from other land uses, such as housing. There are clusters of existing industrial activity along key transport routes. These sites need to be protected to support the long term needs of the borough and the role of the City of London and Canary Wharf as global economic hubs (some services need to be in close proximity to the end user and immediately available). This will be achieved through the Tower Hamlets Local Plan 229 INCLUSIVE ECONOMY AND GOOD GROWTH designation of the Strategic Industrial Locations (Empson Street and Fish Island/Bow Goodsyard) and Local Industrial Locations (see Part 1). 15.24 For the purposes of this chapter, industrial uses are considered to include: z light and general industry (use Classes E(g)(iii) and B2); z storage and logistics/distribution (use Class B8);
